page.title: 16FARM MACHINERY IN SAMPFORD
page.content: {THE MACHINE YEAR cont'd The bale fork is put on the front end of a tractor and stacks the flat pattern of eight bales into five layers.The bale carrier at the back lifts forty bales at a time to stack in a barn or pile. The plough is pulled behind a tractor and cuts and turns the earth.This burries any remaining stubble. A harrow is some discs pulled by a tractor,These chop up the clods of dirt. Rolls are pulled by a tractor.These are heavy cylinders which flatten the field. Drills are pulled by a tractor,this makes holes in the ground and plants the seeds in them.
